com.bluecreation.melodysmart

Class I2CService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bluecreation.melodysmart.LEService
      • com.bluecreation.melodysmart.I2CService

  • public class I2CService
extends LEService
    Interface with the I2C service in MelodySmart

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  I2CService.Listener
      Class used to report the application or module accessing a MelodySmart device about changes in the I2C service.

    • Method Detail

      • writeData

        public boolean writeData(byte[] data,
                         byte deviceAddress)
        Writes some data over the I2C service to the remote device
        Parameters:
        data - The data to be written. Commonly, the first two bytes will contain a register address. The maximum size of 19 bytes
        deviceAddress - The I2C address of the device
        Returns:
        Whether the operation succeeded (true) or not (false)

      • readData

        public boolean readData(byte[] writePortion,
                        byte deviceAddress,
                        byte length)
        Reads some data
        Parameters:
        writePortion - The data portion to be send after the device address. Normally, this is the register address to read from.
        deviceAddress - The I2C address of the device
        length - The number of byte to be read from the givel location. The maximum value is 19.
        Returns:
        true on success, false on failure

      • send

        public void send(byte[] data)
        Send some data over the I2C service . If the service is not available, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to send

      • registerListener

        public void registerListener(I2CService.Listener listener)
        Registers a new listener that will get notified about events from this service. If the listener is null or has previously been registered, nothing happens
        Parameters:
        listener - The new listener to registerv

      • unregisterListener

        public void unregisterListener(I2CService.Listener listener)
        Removes a listener that will stop being reported about events from this service If the listener is null or has not been previously registered, nothing happens
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to remove
